title: A Life of Integrity
sub_title: The Value of a Good Name
devotional:
Old Mr. Abernathy was known in town for two things: his meticulously kept rose garden and his unwavering honesty. He ran a small hardware store, a place where a handshake was as good as a contract, and his word was his bond. One sweltering summer day, a young woman rushed into the store, flustered. She needed a specific fitting for a vintage garden hose; the annual town flower show was the next day, and her prize-winning hydrangeas were wilting fast. Mr. Abernathy, after a diligent search, found a fitting that looked promising. "This is the last one I have," he said, his eyes twinkling, "and I'm not entirely sure it's a perfect match, but give it a try. If it doesn't work, bring it back tomorrow, no charge."

The next day, the woman returned, radiant. "It worked perfectly!" she exclaimed. "My hydrangeas are saved, and I won first prize! Thank you so much!" She offered to pay, but Mr. Abernathy just smiled. "The joy of helping is payment enough," he said. Later that week, a supplier offered Mr. Abernathy a deal on a shipment of tools – a steep discount, but only if he agreed to misrepresent their quality to customers. Mr. Abernathy refused without hesitation. "My reputation," he explained, "is worth more than any amount of money. I sleep well at night knowing I treat everyone fairly."

Mr. Abernathy's life was a testament to integrity – a life lived with unwavering honesty and strong moral principles, even when it wasn't the easiest path. It's a reminder that true success isn't measured in dollars or accolades, but in the richness of character and the trust we build with others. Integrity is not about never making mistakes; it is about owning up to them, learning from them, and striving to do what is right, always.
image_description: A weathered wooden toolbox filled with an assortment of antique hand tools sitting on a workbench with soft natural light.
insights: Proverbs 11:3 states, 'The integrity of the upright guides them, but the unfaithful are destroyed by their duplicity.' This verse highlights the protective and guiding nature of integrity. It's not merely about avoiding wrongdoing, but about actively choosing the path of righteousness. Similarly, Psalm 25:21 says, 'May integrity and uprightness protect me, because my hope, Lord, is in you.' Integrity, therefore, becomes a shield, guarding us from the pitfalls of dishonesty and deceit.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I ask for the strength to live with integrity in all that I do. Help me to resist the temptation to compromise my values for personal gain or recognition. Grant me the courage to speak the truth, even when it is difficult, and to act with honesty and fairness in all my dealings. May my life be a reflection of Your righteousness, a testament to the transformative power of integrity. In Jesus’ name, Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life are you being challenged to compromise your integrity? What small steps can you take today to strengthen your commitment to honesty and ethical behavior? How can you be a positive example of integrity to those around you?
